fields.name: path
fields.title: Path
fields.description: Path of the Text file/directory

fields.name: separator

fields.description: CSV Separator

fields.name: header
fields.title: Header
fields.description: Does the file have a header row

fields.name: dropMalformed
fields.title: Drop Malformed
fields.description: Whether to drop Malformed records or error

fields.name: outputColNames
fields.title: Column Names for the CSV
fields.description: New Output Columns of the SQL

fields.name: outputColTypes
fields.title: Column Types for the CSV

nodes.name: Split With Stratified Sampling
nodes.description: This node splits the incoming DataFrame into 2. It takes in the fraction to use in splitting the data by Stratified Sampling.
nodes.details:
Split With Stratified Sampling, which is the preferred way to sample from populations with varing subpopulation sizes.

More details are available at : spark.apache.org/docs/latest/api/python/_modules/pyspark/sql/dataframe.html#DataFrame.sampleBy

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: keyInputCol
fields.title: Column Name
fields.description: column that defines strata

fields.name: fraction
fields.title: Fraction
fields.description: sampling fraction for each stratum. If a stratum is not specified, we treat its fraction as zero

fields.name: seed
fields.title: Seed
fields.description: random seed

nodes.name: PrintNRows
nodes.description: Prints the specified number of records in the DataFrame. It is useful for seeing intermediate output

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: n
fields.title: Num Rows to Print
fields.description: number of rows to be printed

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

nodes.name: H2OGBM
nodes.details:
Gradient Boosting Machine (for Regression and Classification) is a forward learning ensemble method. The guiding heuristic is that good predictive results can be obtained through increasingly refined approximations. H2Oâ€™s GBM sequentially builds regression trees on all the features of the dataset in a fully distributed way - each tree is built in parallel.

More details are available at : docs.h2o.ai/h2o/latest-stable/h2o-docs/data-science/gbm.html

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: isResponseIsCategorical
fields.title: isResponseColIsCategorical
fields.description: it Specify a response column type(numeric or categorical). Separates the Classification and Regression

fields.name: offset_column
fields.title: Offset Column
fields.description: Specify a column to use as the offset

fields.name: weights_column
fields.title: Weights Column
fields.description: Specify a column to use for the observation weights, which are used for bias correction

fields.name: ignore_const_cols
fields.title: Ignore Const Colst
fields.description: Specify whether to ignore constant training columns

fields.name: ignored_columns
fields.title: Ignored Columns
fields.description: Specify the column or columns to be excluded from the model

fields.name: learn_rate
fields.title: Learn Rate
fields.description: Specify the learning rate (The range is 0.0 to 1.0)

fields.name: max_depth
fields.title: Max Depth
fields.description: Specify the maximum tree depth (Setting this value to 0 specifies no limit)

fields.name: nfolds
fields.title: NFolds
fields.description: Specify the number of folds for cross-validation

fields.name: ntrees
fields.title: NTrees
fields.description: Specify the number of trees to build

fields.name: build_tree_one_node
fields.title: Build tree one node
fields.description: Specify to run on a single node, check this checkbox

fields.name: max_runtime_secs
fields.title: Max runtime secs
fields.description: Allowed runtime in seconds for model training (Use 0 to disable)

fields.name: seed
fields.title: Seed
fields.description: Specify the random number generator (RNG)

fields.name: stopping_rounds
fields.title: Stopping Rounds
fields.description: Stops training when the option selected for stopping_metric doesnâ€™t improve for the specified number of training rounds, based on a simple moving average

fields.name: stopping_metric
fields.title: Stopping metric
fields.description: Specify the metric to use for early stopping

fields.name: stopping_tolerance
fields.title: Stopping tolerance
fields.description: Specify the relative tolerance for the metric-based stopping to stop training if the improvement is less than this value

fields.name: balance_classes
fields.title: Balance classes
fields.description: Specify whether to oversample the minority classes to balance the class distribution

fields.name: calibrate_model
fields.title: Calibrate model
fields.description: Use Platt scaling to calculate calibrated class probabilities (Defaults to False)

fields.name: categorical_encoding
fields.title: Categorical encoding
fields.description: Specify variuos encoding schemes for handling categorical features

fields.name: check_constant_response
fields.title: Check constant response
fields.description: it Check if the response column is a constant value

fields.name: class_sampling_factors
fields.title: Class sampling factors
fields.description: Specify the per-class (in lexicographical order) over/under-sampling ratios (By default, these ratios are automatically computed during training to obtain the class balance, Note that this requires balance_classes=true)

fields.name: col_sample_rate
fields.title: Col sample rate
fields.description: Specify the column sampling rate (y-axis) (Note that this method is sampling without replacement)

fields.name: col_sample_rate_change_per_level
fields.title: Col sample rate change per level
fields.description: Specify to change the column sampling rate as a function of the depth in the tree (This can be a value > 0.0 and <= 2.0 and defaults to 1)

fields.name: col_sample_rate_per_tree
fields.title: Col sample rate per tree
fields.description: Specify the column sample rate per tree (This can be a value from 0.0 to 1.0 and defaults to 1)

fields.name: min_split_improvement
fields.title: Col sample rate per tree
fields.description: Specify the minimum relative improvement in squared error reduction in order for a split to happen

fields.name: custom_metric_func
fields.title: Custom metric func
fields.description: Specify a custom evaluation function

fields.name: distribution
fields.title: Distribution
fields.description: Specify the distribution (i.e., the loss function),The options are AUTO, bernoulli, multinomial, gaussian, poisson, gamma, laplace, quantile, huber, or tweedie

fields.name: fold_assignment
fields.title: Fold Assignment
fields.description: Specify the cross-validation fold assignment scheme (Applicable only if a value for nfolds is specified and fold_column is not specified)

fields.name: histogram_type
fields.title: Histogram type
fields.description: Specify to cycle through all histogram types (one per tree)

fields.name: keep_cross_validation_fold_assignment
fields.title: Keep CV Fold Assignment
fields.description: Enable to preserve the cross-validation fold assignment

fields.name: keep_cross_validation_predictions
fields.title: Keep CV Predictions
fields.description: Enable to keep the cross-validation predictions

fields.name: learn_rate_annealing
fields.title: Learn Rate Anealing
fields.description: Specifies to reduce the learn_rate by this factor after every tree. So for N trees, GBM starts with learn_rate and ends with learn_rate * learn_rate_annealing**^*N*

fields.name: max_abs_leafnode_pred
fields.title: Max abs leafnode pred
fields.description: Reduces overfitting by limiting the maximum absolute value of a leaf node prediction (Double.MaxValue by default)

fields.name: max_hit_ratio_k
fields.title: Max hit ratio k
fields.description: Specify the maximum number (top K) of predictions to use for hit ratio computation (Applicable to multi-class only)

fields.name: max_after_balance_size
fields.title: MAX after balance size
fields.description: Specify the maximum relative size of the training data after balancing class counts (balance_classes must be enabled)

fields.name: min_rows
fields.title: Min Rows
fields.description: it Specify the minimum number of observations for a leaf (nodesize in R)

fields.name: nbins
fields.title: NBins
fields.description: Specify the number of bins for the histogram to build, then split at the best point (Numerical/real/int only)

fields.name: nbins_cats
fields.title: NBin Cats
fields.description: Specify the maximum number of bins for the histogram to build, then split at the best point (Categorical/enums only)

fields.name: nbins_top_level
fields.title: Nbins top level
fields.description: Specify the minimum number of bins at the root level to use to build the histogram (For numerical/real/int columns only)

fields.name: pred_noise_bandwidth
fields.title: Pred noise bandwidth
fields.description: Specify bandwidth (sigma) of Gaussian multiplicative noise ~N(1,sigma) for tree node predictions

fields.name: score_each_iteration
fields.title: Score Each Iteration
fields.description: Specify whether to score during each iteration of the model training

fields.name: score_tree_interval
fields.title: Score tree interval
fields.description: Score the model after every so many trees (Disabled if set to 0)

fields.name: huber_alpha
fields.title: Huber alpha
fields.description: Specify the desired quantile for Huber/M-regression (the threshold between quadratic and linear loss)

fields.name: quantile_alpha
fields.title: Quantile alpha
fields.description: Specify the quantile to be used for Quantile Regression (Only applicable if Quantile is specified for distribution)

fields.name: tweedie_power
fields.title: Tweedie power
fields.description: Specify the Tweedie power. The range is from 1 to 2 (Only applicable if Tweedie is specified for distribution)

fields.name: sample_rate
fields.title: Sample rate
fields.description: Specify the row sampling rate (x-axis). (Note that this method is sample without replacement)

fields.name: sample_rate_per_class
fields.title: Sample rate per class
fields.description: Specifies that each tree in the ensemble should sample from the full training dataset using a per-class-specific sampling rate rather than a global sample factor (as with sample_rate)
